headline.main: Article 5 -- No Title; The science of sight is progressing, but still dimly understood: Don't be so sure that bright lights are good. Be alert to glaucoma and all sources of pain or distortion. Be suspicious if sight at close range improves.

docs.abstract: David Dempsey article on science of sight; describes eye ailments such as cataracts, glaucoma and corneal and retinal diseases; describes new techniques to aid and prevent blindness; drawing of eye and eye chart (L)
docs.snippet: David Dempsey article on science of sight; describes eye ailments such as cataracts, glaucoma and corneal and retinal diseases; describes new techniques to aid and prevent blindness; drawing of eye and eye chart (L)

docs.lead_paragraph: DAVIS, Calif., July 18 Scientists at the California Primate Research Center here have reported the results of three longterm experiments using monkeys as models in a search for better understanding of human health problems.

headline.main: SCIENTISTS ASSAY TESTS ON MONKEYS; Birth Defects, Smog Harm and Marijuana Effects Studied in California

docs.abstract: Univ of Calif scientists rept monkeys that had been fed active ingredients of marijuana exhibited behavior pattern of 'irritable aggressiveness'; experiments are aimed at search for better understanding of human health problems (S)
docs.snippet: DAVIS, Calif., July 18 Scientists at the California Primate Research Center here have reported the results of three longterm experiments using monkeys as models in a search for better understanding of human health problems.

byline.original: By SANDRA BLAKESLEE Special to The New York Times
